title: The construction of the Hagia Sophia in Constantinople is completed.
text: The construction of the Hagia Sophia in Constantinople is completed.

title: The Spanish Crown issues the Laws of Burgos, governing the conduct of settlers with regard to native Indians in the New World.
text: The Spanish Crown issues the Laws of Burgos, governing the conduct of settlers with regard to native Indians in the New World.

title: The Zwickau prophets arrive in Wittenberg, disturbing the peace and preaching the Apocalypse.
text: The Zwickau prophets arrive in Wittenberg, disturbing the peace and preaching the Apocalypse.

title: Second Northern War/the Deluge: Monks at the Jasna Góra Monastery in Częstochowa are successful in fending off a month-long siege.
text: Second Northern War/the Deluge: Monks at the Jasna Góra Monastery in Częstochowa are successful in fending off a month-long siege.

title: The Flushing Remonstrance articulates for the first time in North American history that freedom of religion is a fundamental right.
text: The Flushing Remonstrance articulates for the first time in North American history that freedom of religion is a fundamental right.

title: Portugal and England sign the Methuen Treaty which gives preference to Portuguese imported wines into England.
text: Portugal and England sign the Methuen Treaty which gives preference to Portuguese imported wines into England.

title: War of 1812: The American schooner USS Carolina is destroyed. It was the last of Commodore Daniel Patterson's makeshift fleet that fought a series of delaying actions that contributed to Andrew Jackson's victory at the Battle of New Orleans.
text: War of 1812: The American schooner USS Carolina is destroyed. It was the last of Commodore Daniel Patterson's makeshift fleet that fought a series of delaying actions that contributed to Andrew Jackson's victory at the Battle of New Orleans.

title: Charles Darwin embarks on his journey aboard HMS Beagle, during which he will begin to formulate his theory of evolution.
text: Charles Darwin embarks on his journey aboard HMS Beagle, during which he will begin to formulate his theory of evolution.

title: The worst ever avalanche in England occurs at Lewes, Sussex, killing eight people.
text: The worst ever avalanche in England occurs at Lewes, Sussex, killing eight people.

title: Ether anesthetic is used for childbirth for the first time by Dr. Crawford Long in Jefferson, Georgia.
text: Ether anesthetic is used for childbirth for the first time by Dr. Crawford Long in Jefferson, Georgia.

title: Journalist John L. O'Sullivan, writing in his newspaper the New York Morning News, argues that the United States had the right to claim the entire Oregon Country "by the right of our manifest destiny".
text: Journalist John L. O'Sullivan, writing in his newspaper the New York Morning News, argues that the United States had the right to claim the entire Oregon Country "by the right of our manifest destiny".

title: "Jana Gana Mana", the national anthem of India, is first sung in the Calcutta Session of the Indian National Congress.
text: "Jana Gana Mana", the national anthem of India, is first sung in the Calcutta Session of the Indian National Congress.

title: The Great Poland Uprising against the Germans begins.
text: The Great Poland Uprising against the Germans begins.

title: Japanese aircraft carrier Hōshō becomes the first purpose built aircraft carrier to be commissioned in the world.
text: Japanese aircraft carrier Hōshō becomes the first purpose built aircraft carrier to be commissioned in the world.

title: Kern and Hammerstein's musical play Show Boat, considered to be the first true American musical play, opens at the Ziegfeld Theatre on Broadway.
text: Kern and Hammerstein's musical play Show Boat, considered to be the first true American musical play, opens at the Ziegfeld Theatre on Broadway.

title: Soviet General Secretary Joseph Stalin orders the "liquidation of the kulaks as a class".
text: Soviet General Secretary Joseph Stalin orders the "liquidation of the kulaks as a class".

title: Radio City Music Hall, "Showplace of the Nation", opens in New York City.
text: Radio City Music Hall, "Showplace of the Nation", opens in New York City.

title: Regina Jonas is ordained as the first female rabbi in the history of Judaism.
text: Regina Jonas is ordained as the first female rabbi in the history of Judaism.

title: The 7.8 Mw Erzincan earthquake shakes eastern Turkey with a maximum Mercalli intensity of XI (Extreme). At least 32,700 people were killed.
text: The 7.8 Mw Erzincan earthquake shakes eastern Turkey with a maximum Mercalli intensity of XI (Extreme). At least 32,700 people were killed.

title: Winter War: Finland holds off a Soviet attack in the Battle of Kelja.
text: Winter War: Finland holds off a Soviet attack in the Battle of Kelja.

title: The International Monetary Fund is created with the signing of an agreement by 29 nations.
text: The International Monetary Fund is created with the signing of an agreement by 29 nations.

title: Indonesian National Revolution: The Netherlands officially recognizes Indonesian independence. End of the Dutch East Indies.
text: Indonesian National Revolution: The Netherlands officially recognizes Indonesian independence. End of the Dutch East Indies.

title: The Cave of Swallows, the largest known cave shaft in the world, is discovered in Aquismón, San Luis Potosí, Mexico.
text: The Cave of Swallows, the largest known cave shaft in the world, is discovered in Aquismón, San Luis Potosí, Mexico.

title: Apollo program: Apollo 8 splashes down in the Pacific Ocean, ending the first orbital manned mission to the Moon.
text: Apollo program: Apollo 8 splashes down in the Pacific Ocean, ending the first orbital manned mission to the Moon.

title: Spain becomes a democracy after 40 years of fascist dictatorship.
text: Spain becomes a democracy after 40 years of fascist dictatorship.

title: The Soviet Union invades the Democratic Republic of Afghanistan.
text: The Soviet Union invades the Democratic Republic of Afghanistan.

title: Pope John Paul II visits Mehmet Ali Ağca in Rebibbia's prison and personally forgives him for the 1981 attack on him in St. Peter's Square.
text: Pope John Paul II visits Mehmet Ali Ağca in Rebibbia's prison and personally forgives him for the 1981 attack on him in St. Peter's Square.

title: Palestinian guerrillas kill eighteen people inside the airports of Rome, Italy, and Vienna, Austria.
text: Palestinian guerrillas kill eighteen people inside the airports of Rome, Italy, and Vienna, Austria.

title: The Romanian Revolution concludes, as the last minor street confrontations and stray shootings abruptly end in the country's capital, Bucharest.
text: The Romanian Revolution concludes, as the last minor street confrontations and stray shootings abruptly end in the country's capital, Bucharest.

title: Taliban forces retake the strategic Bagram Airfield which solidifies their buffer zone around Kabul, Afghanistan.
text: Taliban forces retake the strategic Bagram Airfield which solidifies their buffer zone around Kabul, Afghanistan.

title: Protestant paramilitary leader Billy Wright is assassinated in Northern Ireland, United Kingdom.
text: Protestant paramilitary leader Billy Wright is assassinated in Northern Ireland, United Kingdom.

title: Two truck bombs kill 72 and wound 200 at the pro-Moscow headquarters of the Chechen government in Grozny, Chechnya, Russia.
text: Two truck bombs kill 72 and wound 200 at the pro-Moscow headquarters of the Chechen government in Grozny, Chechnya, Russia.

title: Radiation from an explosion on the magnetar SGR 1806-20 reaches Earth. It is the brightest extrasolar event known to have been witnessed on the planet.
text: Radiation from an explosion on the magnetar SGR 1806-20 reaches Earth. It is the brightest extrasolar event known to have been witnessed on the planet.

title: Former Pakistani prime minister Benazir Bhutto is assassinated in a shooting incident.
text: Former Pakistani prime minister Benazir Bhutto is assassinated in a shooting incident.

title: Riots erupt in Mombasa, Kenya, after Mwai Kibaki is declared the winner of the presidential election, triggering a political, economic, and humanitarian crisis.
text: Riots erupt in Mombasa, Kenya, after Mwai Kibaki is declared the winner of the presidential election, triggering a political, economic, and humanitarian crisis.

title: Operation Cast Lead: Israel launches 3-week operation on Gaza.
text: Operation Cast Lead: Israel launches 3-week operation on Gaza.

title: Iranian election protests: On the Day of Ashura in Tehran, Iran, government security forces fire upon demonstrators.
text: Iranian election protests: On the Day of Ashura in Tehran, Iran, government security forces fire upon demonstrators.
